--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Mitchell Timin <zenguyuno@y...> wrote:

> 
> In order to compare NEAT to other approaches, the
> processing time to compute the network is important. 

I'm not completely seeing the importance of processing time for 
network activation as a statistic for comparison.  I'm not even sure 
that the activation method should be considered NEAT-specific.  You 
can use any activation method you want with a NEAT network.

> For example, is NEAT fast enough to use a NEAT-evolved
> network in a real time application?
> 

The NN activations generally don't take up significant computation 
time.  We can run 50 networks at the same time in real-time easily 
on a single processor.  Obviously at some huge network size things 
will start slowing down, but then again, what else can you do if a 
huge network is necessary to solve the task?

Anyway, I think most interesting domains assume their cost mostly 
from domain simulation and not network activation.

ken
